does apt-get install dependecies default: when using apt-get install, does this install the dependencies for a particular package, default... or do i need to specify with an option flag?

you're either pretty new or pretty blind if you haven't seen that yet :P ..  test case -> 'sudo apt-get -d install emacs' <- that would only download the pkgs, but it'll most likely ask for confirmation anyway

where do I edit synaptic package manager?
if you want to edit something, edit /etc/apt/sources.list
this is the list of where to download packages from?
note the 2 letters behind the 'http://', that's a top-level domain indicating the country; you could put whatever you like there, I guess, as long as the TLD exists
